title: London tourists waste £100k a year travelling between two closest Tube stations
text:
Tourists and others travelling on the London Underground are pointlessly spending thousands of pounds each week on making a journey between the network’s two closest stations.

A Freedom of Information request by Telegraph Money found that an average of 531 people travelled from Covent Garden to Leicester Square in a typical week, with a further 331 making the journey in the opposite direction.

The Tube journey between the two Piccadilly line stations takes just 45 seconds as the platforms are less than 300 yards apart, Transport for London said.
